lenders.name: Silvia
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference, and I truly think I can, for the first time in my life! Also, it's a wonderful experience to invest in people with great courage. I wish that many many people will get to know about this and will help make this world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I assist the department administrator of a University department (anaesthetics), as well as the head of the department. It's not the most exciting job but I have loads of lovely colleagues and a nice working environment.

lenders.name: Amanda
lenders.loan_because: especially after spending time in Kenya, I have learned that one of the best ways to make an impact in the world is through more personal relationships.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach in a public school; kids ages 5-11; mostly 9 year olds. I also spend a lot of time serving with my church building a relationship with a community in northern Kenya.

lenders.name: Martha McGinnis
lenders.loan_because: As an entrepreneur myself, I respect the courage of these borrowers and the challenges they face.  I am also deeply grateful for all the benefits, opportunities, and assistance I've received in my own life.  This is a wonderful way to pass some of that along to others.
lenders.occupational_info: People in business and organizations hold a lot of meetings, and spend a lot of time, money and energy doing it.  However, they often don't remember them very well afterward.  My job is to listen very carefully during a meeting, and to capture what's important.  So, while it's all happening, I am creating a wall-sized mural that's a colorful combination of words and images.  Later, people use the mural and smaller re-prints to remember, discuss, and share what happened.  The murals also go into slide shows, newsletters, and onto websites--the whole point is to make better use of the meeting!  My biggest role though, is to LISTEN...most people don't do that very well!

lenders.name: Jeff

lenders.occupational_info:

lenders.occupational_info: I work with a lot of families who have just experienced a huge loss. I love the fact I can give something back to them in such a time of need. lenders.name: Nicole
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of small loans on a person to person basis to women who have the courage to start their own business to make  a better life for themselves and support their  children to get an education. What I find attractive with the Kiva project is that this form of assistance is not charity. A small loan makes such good sense.  I wished this project was much more widely known amongst the more affluent of us who despair of our own governments and international organisations failing to tackle poverty and diseases.

lenders.name: TirzaTajunTarjaniTarini
lenders.whereabouts: Seaside and London, UK & Bergisch Gladbach, Germany
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a great way, to enable someone somewhere in the world to improve their living conditions, and I can re-invest the money once the loan is repaid. In this way, one sum can continually help people, rather than being a one-off. Also, it is nice to know that some people, who would be ashamed to receive donations as gifts, can keep their personal dignity intact by repaying the money once they have made an additional income with their loan and thus giving the money free to help somewhere else. I also give money to various other charities, like kidshelp-kambodscha.de, PETA and Greenpeace, etc. - (animals & children cannot pay back loans, of course, same as prisoners of conscience, whom we support via amnesty international)  but as we work on a tight budget, being able to continuously re-use the money given here, makes it especially valuable to us as much as to the recipient(s) that we support in this way! Great system!
lenders.occupational_info:
Writing and reading are my passion, so that is what I do. I write stories and poems and am a voice over artist. Also, I am a mother of three. My children are a boy and two girls, born 99, 02 & 07 - and I adore my little indigo/crystal/rainbow children. Awesome individuals. I raise them with great spiritual awareness, so they are as much in sync with themselves and the universe as possible. 

I am a Scorpio, graduated from school in Germany, then lived in London, UK, for eight years, where I studied at the universities of SOAS and UNL, graduating in HND in Leisure & Tourism Management & BA Tourism Studies with Marketing. 

Just after my final graduation, I got pregnant with my son and decided to move back to Germany. I have worked ever since in a wide range of jobs.

When I feel like I need time off, I turn on the music and dance through the livingroom - or spend an evening watching a movie that is 16 plus when the children are in bed. :D

I am a social person and love to meet old and make new friends. Due to private ties and also work, I move between countries now, from Germany to UK and back. I love travelling and seeing the world, meeting lots of interesting new people. I enjoy life a lot and endeavour to live each moment to the full. :D

My children and I choose the loans together. Moreover, on each of our birthdays, the birthday child is allowed to choose a loan by itself. This way, I ensure my children grow up to be spiritually developed and socially aware, responsible human beings. :D

Love and Light to all,

Tirza, Tajun, Tarjani & Tarini

lenders.name: William Logai
lenders.occupational_info:
Hope Ofiriha was founded by 12 widows in Lofiriha on July 27th, 1999. The charity is registered with Magwi County local government - Department of community services. 

Initially the charity assisted widows only, to identify and implement solutions to a variety of problems confronting them in the rural areas during the war. Local training and other projects promoting the conditions of widows were initiated. Since its inception, William Logai Ochieng and Linda Acen Abili re – started Hope ofiriha in 2006. They broaden its original purpose and begun to encompass projects beyond those narrowly aimed at widow’s training.The charity subsequently embarked to promote the issues affecting women, girls, and children as a whole in Lofiriha community, Magwi County, Sudan.
3 images places here

Ochieng and Abili have interest for Lofiriha people and in particular the area and the people around Omiling, where the charity is based. Ochieng brings a broad of commercial experience to Hope ofiriha, after having run his own business for several years and Abili has an administrative background from Juba University. Putting together their skills has meant that the charity has developed into anefficient, a fun and well organised organisation. They are realists, not idealists, and believing in giving a hand up, not a hand out!


They feel it is important that costs are kept to a minimum – for example, the design and maintenance of the website and all administrative work is done by them at no cost to the charity.

Hope ofiriha only employs local people, mostly women, and they are responsible for the day to day running of the projects. Ochieng and Abili are in daily contact with the senior managers, who provide progress reports on the projects. Ochieng regularly visits Lofiriha community to keep an eye on how the charity is running and to develop new programmes. They spend time training and empowering Hope ofiriha`s managers and staff, and meeting with members of the Lofiriha local community in most cases.

Hope ofiriha is different to most charities working in Sudan. So much money is spent on administration, monitoring, report writing, inefficient systems, etc., that very little money actually finds its way to the people who the donors wished to help. Hope ofiriha is based at Omiling and has minimal local overheads. The charity deals directly with the local communities, and it is made clear that Hope ofiriha helps people who help themselves. The charity often acts as a catalyst to make things happen.

Hope ofiriha has 425 local Lofiriha members who generously support the charity with their donations. 

Hope ofiriha is involved with education, micro –loans, child sponsorship, and healthcare locally to Lofiriha community. It is also actively involved in an environmental tree planting and reforestation project in Onura which covers an area of 2,000 Sq.km.

lenders.name: WholeKidsAdventure
lenders.loan_because: ...of the amazing success stories!!! I believe in helping people who are willing to help themselves!
lenders.occupational_info:
Whole Kids Adventure, a Texas domestic non-profit corporation, was organized to provide a unique child development model that will focus on establishing healthy eating habits and increasing physical activity levels in preschool age children and their families in order to prevent the development of obesity and related health problems. We will provide health education for our WKA families and the general public!

Our priority is child obesity, an issue that influences most families in America. We are concerned about the growing obesity epidemic in children, and adolescents, a trend that will have social consequences throughout life.

We are currently establishing partnerships with organizations that support our WKA mission, and in addition we are working with local farms to set up a Food Co-Op to allow not only our children but also our families to enjoy fresh organic produce at an affordable rate directly from the farm!  

In addition to the Co-op, we are starting a Gardening program and will be setting up Community Garden(s) WITH and FOR our families. We are focused to GROW WITH and HELP EXPAND the LOCAL FOOD CULTURE!

Our first location will be non-toxic and environmentally friendly...

The sequel is due out in spring of 2014 and will be titled: The Light Never Lies.
